file_content.text: I still can't get a signal to the Alliance. That shuttle is our only way to escape.
Commiseration: What a shame I can't let you take it.
Look, he's just like you!
I've uploaded HK's memory core. You should have unrestricted access to the Alliance base.
That looks like me! But I sound so... professional.
I'll wipe his short-term memory and ensure he can't identify us.
Good. I'm off to Odessen. Wish me luck.
Happy hunting.
Taunt: Surprise!
Musing: It all makes sense.
This explains your presence in the lab--among other things.
Grievance: That stings.
I would be very hurt, if my personality matrix allowed it. You conspired with the enemy.
Accusation: You're a spy!
Confess! You've been with the enemy all along!
Noooo, I think I'd remember that. There's no record of that conversation in my datafiles.
Theory: An accident in the lab. When you applied the electrical surge to erase his memories, it must have destroyed yours instead.
But that would mean I'm... bad? Oh, no!
Assurance: You'll be fine.
Not to worry. You'll forget the next time you reboot.
Optimism: It could be worse.
At least you're not a protocol droid.
Confirmation: Obviously.
Understatement of the millennium.
Indignation: I am not! I am a flawless copy of the original HK-55, programmed to protect my master's lair--and property.
Declaration: I will now commence blasting.
No! You won't hurt my friend!
Vow: You won't take her.
Over my smoking chassis. The Shroud will not hold us prisoner.
Taunt: You can try.
Good luck, not-me. Zeeyo is quite a fighter.
Perplexity: But she's useless.
What would the Shroud want with a defective droid?
Relish: You don't know the truth. This will be delightful.
I will ensure Zeeyo remains here.
Yeah! Wait...
Grrr!
